definition: to bank up with earth/to cultivate (lit. or fig.)/to train (people)
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: Moulds can be made of your limbs and new bits and bobs grown in a Petri dish while you wait.
sentences.chinese: 你的四肢和各種臟器的模具可在皮氏培養皿裏生成。

sentences.english: "We made hair-cell-like cells in a petri dish, " said Oshima.
sentences.chinese: 我們已在有蓋培養皿中成功造出了類毛細胞。

sentences.english: However, this conflict had previously only been shown in test tubes and Petri dishes, says West.
sentences.chinese: 但是，只是在試管中和皮氏培養皿中發現了這種衝突。

sentences.english: While working one day, Alexander Fleming (1881-1955) sneezed onto a culture dish.
sentences.chinese: 亞歷山大佛萊明有天工作時，打了噴嚏到培養皿中。

sentences.english: None of these things can remain in a 300, 000-person Petri dish.
sentences.chinese: 沒什麼能留在30萬人的培養皿裏。

sentences.english: Slob that he was, he left a dirty petri dish in the lab sink.
sentences.chinese: 而馬虎如他，把一個髒培養皿丟在實驗室的水池裏。

sentences.english: A weeks-old eel larva in a petri dish glows under blue light.
sentences.chinese: 培養皿中一週大的鰻魚苗在藍色燈光下發光。

sentences.english: They then applied the substances to a culture of human cells.
sentences.chinese: 接着，科學家們將這些眼妝加入人體細胞的培養皿。

sentences.english: Remember those little Petri dishes from your lab experiments in high school?
sentences.chinese: 記不記得高中實驗課上的培養皿？

definition: seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
to buy on a considerable scale/to purchase/to procure/to stock up

pinyin: zi4 ran2 yu3 yan2 chu3 li3
